p: The aim of this research was to produce and characterize, from a chemical and sensory point of view, two citrus-flavoured olive oils ( COOs) in comparison with an unflavoured EVOO. COOs were obtained through the direct addition of cryo-macerated citrus peels (from lemon and orange of Massa Carrara province, Tuscany) in the olive mill, together with fresh olives (from Tuscany varieties too) during oil extraction [ 9, 10]. Since citrus peel is rich in polyphenols [ 11] and characterized by the presence of typical essential oils [ 12], analyses of the main phenolic compounds as well as of the volatile organic compounds in COOs were performed. Essential oils of the citrus peels added for COOs production were also investigated.
